abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the project were as
            follows: the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability
            was highly likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial; and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that the critical
            strategic question faced by the project was how could the
            process of reforms be started in a country where the
            government lacked experience with a market economy? The
            project responded with a strategy of across-the-board
            reforms, which necessarily involved complexity in the number
            of components and implementing agencies. Institutional
            analysis and strategy should, however, be an essential part
            of development of an institution-building technical
            assistance project. In this case the institutional analysis
            would likely have suggested additional ways to bolster
            implementation capacity. Institutional analysis should
            include an examination of whether needed authority resides
            in the implementation agency to enforce compliance by line
            ministries. A traditional lesson is that borrower commitment
            and capability are the critical factors in the success of
            Technical Assistance (TA) projects. Flexible design in TA
            projects requires intensive and experienced supervision,
            because it requires continuous dialogue at high levels of
            government, inter alia, to convince Borrowers on the value
            and benefits of technical assistance, anticipate changes
            needed, and interact on the substantive issues for which the
            technical assistance is provided. Continuity of project
            management and of IDA supervision greatly facilitated proper
            implementation. The Bank maintained one unit and task team
            leader for the project in its final four years. Continuity
            in Project Implementation Unit (PIU) management was equally
            important. Institution building takes substantially longer
            to effect than commonly assumed. If necessary, it should be
            supported over a series of projects.
